worms.model

Class Worm

  • java.lang.Object
    • worms.model.Worm

  • public class Worm
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of Worms, each involving a horizontal and vertical position, an orientation, a radius, a name, a mass, a number of action points, a maximal radius and a maximal number of action points. Each worm is able to move, turn or jump, depending on their parameters. Worms also share a density, which defines a relation between their mass and radius, and a standard acceleration, which determines how far they can jump.
    Version:
    1.7
    Author:
    Yasmine Baestaens and Sander Leyssens (Bachelor of Mathematics)

        Initialize a new worm with the given name, the given horizontal and vertical position, the given orientation, the given radius and the given number of action points
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this worm.
        horizontalPosition - The initial horizontal position for this worm.
        verticalPosition - The initial vertical position for this worm.
        orientation - The initial orientation for this worm.
        radius - The initial radius for this worm.
        actionPoints - The initial number of action points for this worm.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The name or radius is not valid. | !isValidName(name) || !isValidRadius(radius)

      • move

        public void move(int steps)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Move the worm the given number of steps in the direction it is currently facing. Decrease the number of action points accordingly.
        Parameters:
        steps - The number of steps this worm should move.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given number of steps is not a positive number. |steps<0
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The worm does not have enough action points to move this far. |getCurrentNumberOfActionPoints()< Math.ceil(steps*(Math.abs(Math.cos(getOrientation())+ | 4*Math.abs(Math.sin(getOrientation())))))

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int steps)
        Return a boolean reflecting whether this worm can move the given number of steps.
        Parameters:
        steps - The number of steps to be moved.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given number of steps is larger than or equal to zero, and the current number of action points is greater than the number of steps, multiplied by the sum of the absolute values of the cosine of the orientation and four times the sine of the orientation, rounded up. | getCurrentNumberOfActionPoints() >= Math.ceil(steps*(Math.abs(Math.cos(getOrientation())+ | 4*Math.abs(Math.sin(getOrientation()))))) && steps >=0

      • turn

        public void turn(double rotationAngle)
        Turn the worm according to the given angle of rotation.
        Parameters:
        rotationAngle - The given angle of rotation.

      • isValidRotationAngle

        @Raw
public boolean isValidRotationAngle(double rotationAngle)
        Check if a given angle is a valid angle of rotation for this worm.
        Parameters:
        rotationAngle - The given angle of rotation.
        Returns:
        True if and only if there are enough action points to rotate the worm the given angle of rotation. | result == Math.ceil(Math.abs(rotationAngle)*60/(2*Math.PI)) <= getCurrentNumberOfActionPoints()

      • jump

        public void jump()
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 BadOrientationException
        Let this worm jump to the left or to the right across a distance determined by this worm's current number of action points and by its orientation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This worm does not have any action points. | this.getCurrentNumberOfActionPoints()==0
        BadOrientationException - This worm is facing downwards. | this.getOrientation() > Math.PI

      • jumpTime

        @Raw
public double jumpTime()
                throws BadOrientationException
        Return the time this worm would need to jump.
        Returns:
        The jumping distance of this worm, divided by the product of its initial velocity and the cosine of its orientation, otherwise. | else result == getJumpDistance()/(getInitialVelocity()*Math.cos(getOrientation()));
        Throws:
        BadOrientationException - This worm is facing downwards | this.getOrientation() > Math.PI

      • jumpStep

        @Raw
public double[] jumpStep(double time)
        Return the position of this worm, the given time after the start of a jump.
        Parameters:
        time - The time (in seconds) that has passed since this worm has started to jump.
        Returns:
        If the worm has the right orientation to jump, the physical position this worm would have if the given time has passed since the start of the jump. |result == {this.getHorizontalPosition()+getInitialVelocity()*Math.cos(getOrientation())*time , | this.getVerticalPosition()+getInitialVelocity()*Math.sin(getOrientation())*time | - 1/2*STANDARD_ACCELERATION*Math.pow(time,2)};
